description.narrative: On March 6, 2020, the first case of COVID-19 was detected in Costa Rica, days before the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the condition of pandemic (March 11). On March 16, 2020, under presidential decree No. 42227, the state of emergency is established throughout the territory of the Republic of Costa Rica, due to the health emergency situation due to the COVID-19 disease. In order to coordinate actions for emergency care, a General Emergency Plan is drawn up, instructed by Law No. 8488, which allows the application of resources that are necessary for the agile and timely attention of the emergency. The CNE Board of Directors is the institution responsible for approving the Plan and allocating the resources that enter the National Emergency Fund (FNE) to attend to the emergency. The General Emergency Plan, has 6 components of intervention: • Containment measures • Health system response • Logistics of emergency operations • Hygiene and protection measures • Social and humanitarian assistance • Projects linked to recovery The contribution of the Kingdom of the Netherlands will be made to the acquisition of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE): masks, gloves, gowns, boots and protective glasses to cover part of the component of "hygiene and protection measures" whose value rises up to USD 18,000 ,000. Being this component in which the Netherlands will make a contribution of EUR 150,000 (USD 168.539 –corporate rate of 0.89-), the CNE estimates that there is still a shortage of around USD 709,733.01 to cover the needs of this component. The objective of this component is to prevent contagion through the promotion of hygiene habits and practices among the population and in the development of public service activities of institutions and companies, hoping to contain the number of infected people.
